thread.title: Ford Debuts Its EcoSport SUV on Snapchat with DJ Khaled
thread.title_full: Ford Debuts Its EcoSport SUV on Snapchat with DJ Khaled

posts.author: Nick Lucchesi
posts.title: Ford Debuts Its EcoSport SUV on Snapchat with DJ Khaled
posts.text:
Ford Debuts Its EcoSport SUV on Snapchat with DJ Khaled The tiny SUV makes a splashy entrance. Cars November 15, 2016 
D J Khaled, reigning king of Snapchat, was perhaps the best person on the planet for automaker Ford to use to debut its EcoSport on Monday in Los Angeles. With Ryan Seacrest, of course. 
‚ÄúRyan, you gotta bear with me, I gotta type out my caption, so important,‚Äù the prolific DJ and pure ray of sunshine told Seacrest, focused on his phone in front of an audience of a few thousand who waited, patiently. When he finished, he launched into ‚ÄúAll I Do Is Win,‚Äù his 2010 global hit. People used Snapchat to record the moment. 
The Snapchat debut of the EcoSport (pronounced ‚Äúecho,‚Äù short for ecosystem, or ecology), was, according to Ford, the first-ever reveal of a car on the platform. To remind people, Khaled ‚Äî later joined by Fat Joe and Remy Ma ‚Äî shouted out ‚ÄúEcoSport!‚Äù more than a dozen times from a stage set up off the intersection of Hollywood & Highland, while flanked by two of the cars on stage. 
‚ÄúIf you got the keys like I got the keys to this EcoSport, put your hands up!‚Äù 
The Ford EcoSport ‚Äî a popular compact SUV launched in 2003 but primarily sold in Europe ‚Äî is now being marketed to millennials who would rather spend their money on Coachella or Comic-Con, and want the car to help them do that. 
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs knowing that in your life, you‚Äôre going to make trade-offs,‚Äù Cristina Aquino, a Ford marketing manger told Inverse about Ford‚Äôs intended customer, after Khaled‚Äôs set ended. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to make a decision to focus on spending on a vehicle that will help you have the capability to experience the life you want.‚Äù Seacrest uses the EcoSport as a drum. 
That means a smaller, less expensive, and likely more fuel-efficient car. If that sounds great, the bad news is that the EcoSport doesn‚Äôt go on sale for more than a year, in early 2018. 
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not unusual, but for us, it‚Äôs also strategically a great idea to spend some time building a relationship with the customers,‚Äù Aquino told Inverse when asked about the long run-up. 
Ford has not announced a price range, but it‚Äôs expected to be slightly below that of Ford Escape, which starts at $23,000. Ford‚Äôs got competition. The small SUV class is quickly becoming very competitive and crowded. For instance, also at the LA Auto Show, Toyota will debut the CH-R, another subcompact SUV. 
The EcoSport features a slew of futuristic features, including an eight-inch digital tablet that sort of floats on the center dash, and there‚Äôs a B&O Play sound system trumpeted by Ford, that includes ten speakers on the high-end. There are two USB ports. There are some 30 ‚Äústorage solutions,‚Äù many in the form of little bins to keep your stuff, Karen Sullivan, another Ford marketing manager, told Inverse . The car has a roomy interior, and at first glance, the exterior gives off the vibe of a hollowed-out, candy-colored jelly bean. (It will come in ten colors.) We just revealed the all-new #Ford #EcoSport at #LAAutoShow . Keep up with our new SUV here: https://t.co/zN35xrZMq0 pic.twitter.com/EfWtBZ9PJX ‚Äî Ford Motor Company (@Ford) November 15, 2016 
So, Ford clearly has high hopes for this new car. The event on Monday was the first night of a three-day music and lifestyle festival called ‚ÄúGo Small, Live Big.‚Äù It‚Äôs all built around marketing the EcoSport and its attached lifestyle. A parking lot behind the El Capitan Theatre was filled with beach umbrellas, stalls selling fried donuts and acai bowls, two model tiny homes , and zoo housed in a geodesic dome (featuring a meme-ready porcupine, rabbit, chinchilla, and owl). There was a screen printing station and sand was trucked-in for a beach scene. DJ Khaled 
So yeah, the affair was expectedly splashy . And if anybody during the free concert forgot why it was happening, Khaled was there to remind them. 
‚ÄúI think he said EcoSport about a million times, we should know how to pronounce it by now,‚Äù Sullivan said. Photos via Sam VarnHagen

posts.author: Motor Trend Staff
posts.title: 2018 Ford EcoSport First Look Review
posts.text:
2018 Ford EcoSport First Look Review Motor Trend 6 hrs ago Motor Trend Staff 2018 Ford EcoSport First Look Review The subcompact crossover market is exploding in the U.S., and Ford is looking to get in on the action by bringing its Fiesta-based EcoSport stateside. The tiny crossover, which has been on sale in other markets around the world since 2003, gets a face-lift for its U.S. debut ahead of the L.A. Auto Show.
Research Make (e.g. Mazda) Acura Alfa Romeo AM General Aston Martin Audi Bentley BMW Buick Cadillac Chevrolet Chrysler Daewoo Dodge Eagle Ferrari Fiat Fisker Ford Genesis Geo GMC Honda Hummer Hyundai Infiniti Isuzu Jaguar Jeep Kia Lamborghini Land Rover Lexus Lincoln Lotus Maserati Maybach Mazda McLaren Mercedes-Benz Mercury MINI Mitsubishi Nissan Oldsmobile Plymouth Pontiac Porsche Ram Rolls-Royce Saab Saturn Scion smart SRT Subaru Suzuki Tesla Toyota Volkswagen Volvo The 2018 Ford EcoSport looks mostly the same as it did when the second-gen model arrived for the 2012 model year. The front end adopts the new corporate hexagonal grille along with new headlights and foglights. The interior has also been brought up to date with a free-standing infotainment screen and a simplified dash design.
The EcoSport will be offered in four trim levels: S, SE, SES, and Titanium. Buyers will have a choice between two powertrains: the 1.0-liter turbocharged EcoBoost I-3 or a 2.0-liter naturally aspirated I-4. Ford doesn't reveal specs for those engines, but the 1.0-liter EcoBoost makes 123 hp and 125 lb-ft of torque in the Fiesta and Focus, and Ford's 2.0-liter makes 160 hp and 146 lb-ft in the Focus. Both engines are backed by a six-speed automatic transmission. Models equipped with the 2.0-liter come standard with all-wheel drive. SES models feature all-wheel drive, a sport-tuned suspension, and unique styling cues such as copper interior accents.
To appeal to millennials, the Ford EcoSport will be offered in 10 exterior colors and will have seven interior ambient light choices. The EcoSport will also offer a Ford-exclusive 675-watt B&O Play audio system by Harman, which features 10 speakers, including door-mounted tweeters and a rear subwoofer. The EcoSport will also offer Sync 3 infotainment and Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone integration. With FordPass, drivers can locate, start, lock, and unlock their vehicle from their phone.
To help promote its newest crossover addition, Ford is opening a dedicated consumer space in Hollywood. There, prospective buyers can check out the EcoSport and do other things that millennials like to do, like post to Snapchat with a unique geofilter, learn how to do nail art, and dance to live music.
Will Ford's late entry into the subcompact crossover market‚Äîand its aggressive campaign to attract young buyers‚Äîpay off? We'll find out after the EcoSport goes on sale in early 2018.
See more from the LA Auto Show | Follow MSN Autos on Facebook

thread.title: Ford EcoSport Facelift Unveiled At LA Auto Show; India Launch Next Year
thread.title_full: Ford EcoSport Facelift Unveiled At LA Auto Show; India Launch Next Year

posts.title: Ford EcoSport Facelift Unveiled At LA Auto Show; India Launch Next Year
posts.text: Ford EcoSport Facelift Unveiled At LA Auto Show; India Launch Next Year Ford EcoSport Facelift Unveiled At LA Auto Show; India Launch Next Year The EcoSport facelift gets major styling updates to the front The 2017 EcoSport has been comprehensively upgraded with new tech The FordEcoSport facelift will arrive in India by the second half of 2017 Ford Motor Company has finally pulled wraps off the much awaited 2017 EcoSport facelift at the Los Angeles Auto Show, thus marking the subcompact SUV's North American debut. With the facelift, the new EcoSport now gets comprehensive upgrades to the styling, features and powertrain globally, and will be making its way to India as well next year. The 2017 EcoSport's styling is in-line with bigger Ford SUVs 7.51 Lakh * On Road Price (New Delhi) FIND OUT MORE At the outset, the 2017 Ford EcoSport features a reworked front styling and is now in-line with the automaker's new design family. The subcompact SUV now boasts of a massive grille, its most noticeable change as it foregoes the gaping lower grille and slim upper grille seen on the outgoing model. The hexagonal shape has been retained, but the unit is now wider and gets chunkier chrome bars. The headlamp cluster has been tweaked as well to complement the new grille and revised bonnet. You also see a sportier bumper with a faux skid plate, and larger fog lamps on the SUV. Changes are minimal to the EcoSport facelift's rear The side profile remains largely the same, save for the new alloy wheels, whereas new Ford EcoSport a revised bumper at the rear with a larger faux diffuser. The US-spec version misses out on the external spare wheel, so, the license plate has been moved to the tailgate. The cabin gets a clutter free appeal on the EcoSport facelift Inside, Ford has updated the cabin with a revised dashboard and a gets a more clutter free appearance. A new 8-inch floating screen takes centre stage and is now equipped with Ford's Sync 3 entertainment system and also supports Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. The system will allow owners to use Sync Connect with FordPass app that allows users to start, lock, and unlock the vehicle using Bluetooth. There's also the Bang & Olufsen sound system with 10 speakers that makes up to a claimed 675 watt. The 2017 EcoSport is now feature rich with new tech, gets upgraded upholstery too The 2017 EcoSport facelift also comes equipped with two fast-charging USB ports, a 12-volt power outlet, an 110-volt outlet positioned behind the center console, and another 12-volt outlet in the rear. As many as 30 storage spaces are now available in the cabin. Certain markets do not get externally mounted spare wheel on the EcoSport The US spec version will be available in both front-wheel drive and four-wheel drive options, while power will come from the 1.0-litre three-cylinder turbocharged EcoBoost or a 2.0-litre four-cylinder petrol engines. Both motors will be paired to a 6-speed automatic transmission. India will continue to get the external spare wheel on the 2017 Ford EcoSport facelift In india though, the Ford EcoSport facelift will continue with the existing engine options including the 1.0-litre EcoBoost, 1.5-litre petrol and the 1.5-litre TDCi diesel engines. Transmission options will include a 5-speed manual and an autobox, which will send power to the front wheels. The 2017 EcoSport rivals the Mahindra TUV300, Maruti Vitara Brezza and the likes The Ford EcoSport facelift was expected to be unveiled at the Sao Paulo Auto Show last week in Brazil, but the American carmaker chose otherwise. The EcoSport facelift will be going on sale in the US in early 2018 and will be exported from Ford's Chennai based facility. The India launch can be expected in the second half of 2017. It will be interesting though to see how many of the features make it to the India-spec model as well. Do expect to see price hike on the facelifted model when it goes on sale in the country.

posts.title: 2018 Ford EcoSport First Look
posts.text: 2018 Ford EcoSport First Look Ford‚Äôs Big Bet on Going Small   11 Photos The B-Segment crossover market is hot and getting hotter by the day. The Buick Encore, Chevrolet Trax, Mazda CX-3, Honda HR-V are among the current major players in the segment. The Jeep Renegade joined the fray last year, and new entrants are coming soon from other major names. One brand conspicuously absent from this market, at least in North America, has been Ford. In overseas markets, the B-segment EcoSport has been one of its hottest-selling models since 2003. When the last-generation global EcoSport was revealed overseas, we wondered out loud how much longer it would be until this model reached U.S. shores. Well, we have to wonder no longer. The EcoSport is destined for North America in the first quarter of 2018. The precise model year is to be determined. Stylistically, the EcoSport is for all intents and purposes a 7/8-scale Escape. The grille, rear and interior share a strong familiarity with Ford‚Äôs best-selling C-segment crossover. Proportions are slightly more cropped, with a smaller cargo area. The EcoSport breaks prevailing convention small crossover convention with a side-hinged tailgate rather than a top-hinged door. The exterior-mounted ‚Äúskittle‚Äù spare tire cover on global models has been eliminated. North American models will get a fix-a-flat kit. The North American-spec EcoBoost will be powered by either the 1.0L EcoBoost I-3 for front-drive models, or the 2.0L direct-injection naturally aspirated I-4 out of the Focus for all-wheel-drive models. All EcoSport models will offer four-wheel disc brakes with ABS. Power output or estimated fuel economy figures were not announced.   11 Photos Photo 2/11 | 2018 Ford Ecosport Rear Gate Open The EcoSport will be offered in four trim levels, from the base S model, SE, sporty SES and top-of-the-line Titanium. The SES model will be offered with paddle shifters. All N.A.-spec EcoSports will come with a six-speed automatic transmission. North American EcoSport models will be sourced from Chennai, India, making it the first Indian-built vehicle sold in the U.S. market. Fit and finish of the prototype models shown looked up to developed-market standards. Higher-trim models will be offered with a 8-inch touchscreen Sync 3 interface with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto connectivity. Standard on the Titanium model is a 10-speaker, 675-watt B&O Play audio system. SiriusXM satellite radio and HD Radio are optional. In keeping with the vehicle‚Äôs target market of millennials, the EcoSport offers two high-powered USB ports in the front passenger area, with one USB port in the rear seat, and an available 110-volt outlet at the rear of the center console. Pricing will be announced at a later date, but expect it to be in the same ballpark as its peers, meaning a starting price of below $20,000 for the S model, and a well-equipped Titanium going in the mid-to-high 20s. Source: Ford

thread.title: Ford Super Duty is the 2017 Motor Trend Truck of the Year
thread.title_full: Ford Super Duty is the 2017 Motor Trend Truck of the Year

posts.author: Carol Ngo
posts.title: Ford Super Duty is the 2017 Motor Trend Truck of the Year
posts.text:
Toggle the Motor Trend Mobile Search Search Motor Trend / Awards / Truck of the Year / Ford Super Duty is the 2017 Motor Trend Truck of the Year Subscribe to the Free Newsletter Sign Up today for our FREE Newsletter and get the latest articles and news delivered right to your inbox. Subscribe Now Subscribe to the Free Newsletter Sign Up today for our FREE Newsletter and get the latest articles and news delivered right to your inbox. Subscribe Now Ford Super Duty is the 2017 Motor Trend Truck of the Year Heavy is the Truck That Takes the Crown Heavy is the Truck That Takes the Crown Share this article in: Free Price Quote From a Local Dealer View Special Offers No Obligation, Fast & Simple Free New Car Quote Change Car   
‚ÄúWho‚Äôs your favorite for Truck of the Year?‚Äù 
The conversation plays out across the office in the weeks leading up to all the Of The Year competitions. The question comes from all angles: from video producers, art directors, fellow judges, non-participating editors, photographers‚Äîeven the honchos in corporate. We have been thinking about this topic ever since we saw the official invite list of vehicles, sometimes since the launch of a particularly impressive vehicle earlier in the year. We all have our favorites, but it‚Äôs our thorough regimen of testing that determines the winner. Nowhere are those numbers more important than for Truck of the Year. 
An Of The Year contest plays out one of three ways: There‚Äôs no clear winner right up to the end; there are two to three potential winners and a nail-biting vote; or there‚Äôs a clear winner early on and the rest becomes a coronation. In this year‚Äôs Truck of the Year competition, we knew by the halfway point which truck would win. 
Sometimes, one vehicle so clearly satisfies or exceeds our criteria that we spend more time looking for faults than attributes, just to be sure we haven‚Äôt gotten ahead of ourselves. In this year‚Äôs field, the Ford Super Duty trucks emerged as the intuitive choice, one that had to be scrutinized, analyzed, and picked apart in subsequent days of testing. Some competitors rose in standing in the course of our evaluations, but none so much that the Super Duties needed to sweat. Indeed, the Fords‚Äô ability to remain cool under our extreme pressure, regardless of the circumstances, made it all the more clear they deserved this award. Advancement in Design 
Design is inherently subjective, but there are many ways to objectively judge it. Is it cohesive? Do all the individual elements serve a purpose, and do they advance the design as a whole? Does the design separate the vehicle from the competition, and does it speak to its intended market? The Ford Super Duties answer all these questions in the affirmative. 
By their utilitarian nature, trucks can be inherently hard to differentiate. Get too creative, and you risk impinging on the vehicle‚Äôs ability to get the job done‚Äîand for the working professional, that‚Äôs what matters at the end of the day. Clunky but proficient wins over gorgeous and inefficient. The Ford Super Duties strike this balance expertly, looking like no other truck on the road while keeping the customer mission front of mind. They are clearly and distinctly Ford Super Duties seen from afar, and the design doesn‚Äôt break down the closer you look. 
Although the design is busy in places, an obvious vision has been executed. Every panel relates to the adjacent one, even around corners, and every line serves a purpose. Critically, the design as a whole advances the direction of the previous generation without losing or abandoning its signature. From every angle, there is no mistaking this truck for anything but a Ford. Efficiency 
Vehicles of this size‚Äîor, more specifically, this weight‚Äîare not rated by EPA. Fortunately, we have our own means of evaluating fuel efficiency thanks to our partners at Emissions Analytics. 
Subjected to our Real MPG testing regimen, the Ford Super Duties, in all configurations, handily outperformed the equivalent Ram trucks. Given the gas-powered F-250 weighs some 400 pounds less than the Ram 2500 with similar equipment, we expected an advantage and weren‚Äôt surprised to see the Ford return 11.0/16.4/12.9 mpg city/highway/combined versus the Ram‚Äôs 9.2/15./11.4. 
We were far more impressed with the performance of the F-350 dual-rear-wheel diesel. Despite weighing in at 8,643 pounds‚Äî15 pounds heavier than the Ram 3500 dual-rear-wheel diesel‚Äîthe F-350 returned an outstanding 16.3/20.5/18.0 mpg city/highway/combined. Excellent in its own right, the F-350‚Äôs result is all the more impressive compared against the Ram 3500 dually‚Äôs 13.3/17.3/14.8 result. Did we mention class-leading torque and towing/payload capability? 
There are strong arguments to be made for technological advancement and environmental protection, but the Super Duties‚Äô efficiency will most resonate with customers at the pump. Given these trucks do more physical labor than any other class of non-commercial vehicle, the Super Duties‚Äô advantages in efficiency will be a boon to working professionals balancing costs with capability. Engineering Excellence 
Ford ads tout the Super Duty‚Äôs class-leading 32,500-pound towing capacity. (Capabilities of the forthcoming Chevy Silverado HD had not been announced as of this writing.) That‚Äôs impressive. Equally so is the also-class-leading 7,630-pound max payload capacity. 
What the ads don‚Äôt tell you is how the truck actually behaves with 16 tons burdening the rear axle. With a class-leading 925 lb-ft of torque on tap, the F-350 Super Duty will begin rolling forward at idle when you release the brake‚Äîdespite a gross combined vehicle weight of more than 40,000 pounds. That‚Äôs simply stunning torque. Give it some throttle, and it‚Äôs a strong, steady pull to freeway speeds. Braking from such speeds is handled with confidence thanks to a powerful exhaust brake, a well-calibrated Tow/Haul mode, and strong 14-inch rotors front and rear. 
‚ÄúWith 30,000 pounds in tow, the F-350 was remarkably unfazed,‚Äù Chris Walton said. ‚ÄúSure, there‚Äôs a sense of weight behind, but not 15 tons. The engine pulled smoothly through the rev range, the transmission clicked off smooth, quick upshifts without surging, and when it came time to slow after the quarter mile, the Jake brake gave me so much compression braking that I felt extremely confident transitioning from off-throttle to gentle braking for the turnaround.‚Äù 
We had the luxury in this test of having the Super Duty‚Äôs most direct competitor on hand, and it proved instructive. The Super Duties accelerated more quickly and smoothly than their Ram Heavy Duty rivals, braked comparably well, and handled better both on the skidpad and the figure eight. Towing at near max capability, the F-350 was quicker and smoother than the Ram 3500 and felt less burdened. In a trailering slalom test, the F-350 was able to carry considerably more speed than the Ram 3500 and experienced less body roll, increasing driver confidence. The same held true when comparing the gas-powered F-250 to the equivalent Ram 2500. 
On the topic of the gasoline-powered trucks, the F-250‚Äôs aluminum body helped it save 400 pounds relative to the Ram. The F-350 weighs more than the Ram 3500, which Ford attributes to the reinforcements necessary to tow 16 tons. 
The Fords‚Äô advantage became inescapable as we transitioned to a real-world test‚Äîtowing about 7,500 pounds of skid loader up the grueling Davis Dam grade. In a 35‚Äì55-mph uphill passing test, both gasoline- and diesel-powered Ford models clobbered the equivalent Rams in both passing time and distance. 
Of course, no vehicle is perfect, and we‚Äôd be remiss if we didn‚Äôt call out areas for improvement. The gasoline-powered F-250 goes light on the nose when towing uphill, which makes it prone to tramlining and requires more driver attentiveness. Also, on one occasion, the diesel-powered F-250 under cruise control gasped in the heat and failed to maintain its uphill speed despite having adequate power to do so. Finally, all three Ford Super Duty trucks were prone to moderate bump steer on especially bad pavement and expansion joints. Performance of Intended Function 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôve ever evaluated a vehicle that hits this criterion so hard,‚Äù Jonny Lieberman said. None of us argued. Ford has spent an enormous amount of time researching its customers‚Äô needs and wants and finding clever engineering solutions. We know from industry research that the vast majority of heavy-duty truck customers aren‚Äôt weekend cowboys. Capability and usability are king, and Ford has delivered both. 
The suite of work-focused technologies baked into the Super Duties was also highly impressive. Although most folks who drive heavy-duty trucks are everyday pros, we noticed the Ford assistance features best helped rookies and those rusty in trailering. 
Heavy-duty truck customers aren‚Äôt weekend cowboys. Capability and usability are king. 
The ability to extend blind-spot detection to cover a trailer adds an important layer of safety, as does the ability to monitor six trailer tires‚Äô pressures and the trailer lights on the dashboard. Its 360-degree camera coverage greatly aides maneuvering in close quarters, as do forward- and rear-looking cameras. An additional camera mounted above the rear window, as well as the ability to zoom both this camera and the tailgate-mounted backup camera, makes connecting to a trailer a breeze for one person. A dash-mounted tailgate release saves time and effort when attaching a gooseneck or fifth wheel and when loading or unloading. The ability to add an additional wired backup camera to a trailer and display it on the center console is also helpful, as is the trailer-backing guidance with jackknife warning. 
Judges also gave the Super Duties high marks for the inclusion of four 25-amp and two 40-amp auxiliary switches, ready to be connected to power takeoffs and other equipment, and we appreciated the available 400-watt power inverter and two available 110-volt power outlets for charging tools, computers, and more. Safety 
The 2017 Ford Super Duties had not yet been crash tested by either the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety or the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. However, we expect them to perform well because of the strengthened frame. 
Of course, we prefer a vehicle that can avoid collisions in the first place. To increase your chances, Ford has added a number of features, including collision warning, automatic emergency braking, and trailer sway control. All those cameras increase low-speed safety, as does the blind-spot warning system, especially when extended to cover a trailer. Adaptive cruise control helps maintain safe distances both laden and unladen and maintains a set speed on hill descent, even while trailering. 
The Super Duty‚Äôs strong performance in the uphill passing-while-trailering test also indicated a measure of safety, as the trucks are able to more quickly remove themselves from an unsafe situation. CLEAN WIN Across powertrains, cabs, and capabilities, the Ford Super Duties proved themselves the new leaders of the class. Value 
Heavy-duty trucks are expensive. Regardless of make, they all start around $32,000, roughly the average price of a new vehicle in America. That doesn‚Äôt seem so bad. But fully loaded‚Äîand if you are using a heavy-duty truck to its capacity, you tend to load up on options‚Äîthe price more than doubles. Value, then, is not synonymous with price. Rather, it is relative to the competition. 
Here again, the Super Duty compares favorably. When matched with the only other equally capable truck on the market, the Super Duties are priced roughly the same or better than the equivalent Ram trim level‚Äîespecially at higher trim levels. It‚Äôs more than just dollars and cents, though. The Fords offer class-leading towing and hauling. They can also be equipped with a suite of trailering technologies Ram doesn‚Äôt offer. In terms of content per dollar spent, the Super Duties are the clear class leaders. Winners 
As with any Of The Year competition, Truck of the Year is not a direct comparison test. Each truck is judged against our criteria, based on the class it competes in. The Ford F-250 and F-350 score remarkably well on all six‚Äîas well as against their direct competition. With its latest Super Duties, Ford has set new benchmarks for capability and functionality. We have no doubt the competition will race to meet Ford‚Äôs new standard. Putting the competition on notice and forcing them to catch up is a hallmark of an Of The Year winner. Consider the bar raised. 2017 Motor Trend Truck of the Year Contenders

posts.title: Honda, Mazda, Ford And Porsche Highlight 2017 Best Vehicle Brand Awards
posts.text:
U.S. News & World Report has announced the winners of its 2017 Best Vehicle Brand awards. The annual awards recognize brands with top-performing vehicles in four major categories: SUVs ‚Äì including crossovers and minivans ‚Äì cars, trucks and luxury.
Best SUV Brand: Honda
With comfortable interiors and family-friendly features, Honda leads the Best SUV Brand category. Honda‚Äôs lineup includes the Honda CR-V, Honda HR-V, Honda Odyssey and the redesigned Honda Pilot, all of which rank at or near the top of their classes in Compact SUVs, Subcompact SUVs, Minivans and Midsize SUVs, respectively.
Best Car Brand: Mazda
For the second year, Mazda claims the No. 1 spot. Mazda‚Äôs lineup of cars, including the Mazda3 and MX-5 Miata, earn positive reviews for well-made interiors and driving dynamics.
Best Truck Brand: Ford
Ford‚Äôs F-150 line of pickups have fuel-saving engine designs, some of the best payload and tow ratings in the class, easy handling and roomy cabins.
Best Luxury Brand: Porsche
In recent years Porsche has expanded its lineup to include the Panamera, a super-luxury sedan, as well as the Cayenne and Macan SUVs. The models live up to the Porsche‚Äôs performance-driven heritage while also providing the rich interiors and connectivity features that today‚Äôs luxury buyers demand.
‚ÄúConsumers have an overwhelming number of factors to consider when comparing cars,‚Äù Jamie Page Deaton, managing editor of U.S. News Best Cars, said in a statement. ‚ÄúThe Best Vehicle Brand awards simplify the process by giving people guidance on the top brands in the categories that matter to them.‚Äù
The Best Vehicle Brands methodology is an objective, analysis-driven assessment of quality across all of a brand‚Äôs offerings within the four categories. Brand ratings are based on the U.S. News Best Cars overall scores for each vehicle, which incorporate the consensus opinions of the automotive industry as well as safety and reliability data.

thread.title: DJ Khaled Just Introduced Ford's Latest SUV on Snapchat
thread.title_full: DJ Khaled Just Introduced Ford's Latest SUV on Snapchat

posts.author: Christine Birkner
posts.title: DJ Khaled Just Introduced Ford's Latest SUV on Snapchat
posts.text: DJ Khaled Just Introduced Ford's Latest SUV on Snapchat It's the first vehicle reveal on the app By Christine Birkner   Advertising & Branding DJ Khaled revealed the new SUV to his 6 million Snapchat followers. Sources: Ford, Snapchat DJ Khaled recently Snapchatted his son's birth to his 6 million followers, and he just did the same thing for the launch of Ford's new "baby," the EcoSport SUV, which he revealed on Snapchat Monday night. It's the first car officially revealed on Snapchat, according to Ford. "It's different than anything you've ever seen from Ford before, and it starts with who our customer is," said Cristina Aquino, marketing manager at Ford. "Their focus isn't about having stuff‚Äîthey wanted a car that enables them to have experiences. Snapchat lets you share experiences with friends and family, and there's no one who ties to that concept of Snapchat better than DJ Khaled." Ford isn't the first brand to tap into Khaled's larger-than-life personality. The so-called "king of Snapchat," who's known for catchphrases like "major key" and "another one," previously has inked deals with Apple, Ciroc vodka and Silk plant-based milk. Khaled also will appear at Ford's "Go Small, Live Big: L.A." installation, timed to this week's L.A. Auto Show. It's a pop-up village in Los Angeles that will include local food from Smorgasburg LA vendors, a minizoo of tiny animals, a tiny home and demonstrations by professional skateboarders at a Venice-style skate park. The campaign is designed showcase the EcoSport as Ford's smallest SUV but with a big personality for those who believe in "living big," as Khaled does. Adweek responsive video player used on /video.

thread.title: 2018 Ford EcoSport Subcompact Crossover Revealed on Snapchat
thread.title_full: 2018 Ford EcoSport Subcompact Crossover Revealed on Snapchat

posts.author: etahaney
posts.title: 2018 Ford EcoSport Subcompact Crossover Revealed on Snapchat
posts.text:
2018 Ford EcoSport Subcompact Crossover Revealed on Snapchat Small Blue Oval goes big on social media By: Ed Tahaney November 14, 2016 
F ord went social for the launch of its new EcoSport subcompact crossover, unveiling the diminutive ute on Snapchat . FoMoCo used the personal video sharing service to promote the launch of its smallest SUV at an interactive reveal in Hollywood, California. 
The pint-sized EcoSport packs a turbocharged 1.0-liter EcoBoost I-3 or a 2.0-liter I-4 with all-wheel drive. Both engines are mated to a six-speed automatic transmission. In all, the EcoSport will be offered in four trim levels, 10 colors, and with seven ambient lighting options. 
‚ÄúMore people are choosing to spend their time and money sharing experiences with friends and family instead of buying more stuff,‚Äù said Chantel Lenard, executive direct of Ford U.S. marketing, in a statement. ‚ÄúEcoSport fits perfectly into this growing lifestyle. It‚Äôs our smallest SUV, packed with features and personality.‚Äù 
Ford claims that it is the world‚Äôs first-ever vehicle reveal on Snapchat. Speaking of Snapchat reveals and SUVs, a 19-year-old Texas college student recently crashed her Acura while taking a topless Snapchat selfie . 
It seems like the competition‚Äôs SUV doesn‚Äôt offer the connected tech one can find in the all-new Ford EcoSport, which makes it easy to stay in touch with friends and family using the new and improved SYNC 3 system, that‚Äôs optimized for hands-free use. 
Ford says drivers can start, lock, unlock, check fuel levels and find their EcoSport using their latest mobile app. Inside, there are two USB ports, a 12-volt power outlet, and a whopping 30 stowage pockets, bins, and hooks scattered throughout the vehicle. The rear features a moveable floorboard, fold away seats, and a swing-gate-style tailgate for hauling furniture. 
An optional 10-speaker B&O PLAY premium audio system with 675 watts will help drown out the screaming siblings on those long trips to the soccer practice. Fortunately, it‚Äôs standard on EcoSport Titanium. 
Learn more about the reveal that continues this week at FordPresents.com and at the Los Angeles auto show. Ford invites EcoSport visitors to share their experiences on social media with Snapchat geo-filters. Just remember to keep it clean and keep both hands on the wheel.

thread.title: Facelifted Ford EcoSport unveiled
thread.title_full: Facelifted Ford EcoSport unveiled - CarWale News - CarWale

posts.author: Venkat Desirazu
posts.title: Facelifted Ford EcoSport unveiled
posts.text:
A facelifted version of the Ford EcoSport has been unveiled at the 2016 LA Auto Show. This is the most comprehensive update for the compact crossover since it was launched in 2012 and marks its arrival in the American market. The new version of the SUV is expected to arrive in the Indian market sometime in 2017 and will be offered here with both petrol and diesel power.
Externally, the updated Ford EcoSport gets a new grille and lighting package that has taken the SUV‚Äôs appearance from wide and gaping to muscular and angled. The revised headlamps have become sharper and now include projectors. The side profile remains the same but the wheels have undergone a revision. It‚Äôs a similar story at the rear but now a contrast coloured bash plate element has been integrated into the bumper.
While the exterior changes are noticeable, the insides have undergone a major change both in terms of design and features. The single tone grey/black cabin now gets exterior colour co-ordinated inserts for the dashboard/door while the seats too have been given offset body coloured stripes. The fonts on the instrument cluster have been revised and there is a new colour digital display between the pods. However, the biggest addition is that there is now an eight-inch touchscreen system (with a floating display) fitted with the American automaker‚Äôs SYNC 3 system. It is also compatible with Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. Sound comes courtesy of a B&O 10 speaker sound system.
The American market will get the EcoSport with the 1.0-litre EcoBoost motor as well as a 2.0-litre four-cylinder engine. Both engines will only get the option of a six-speed AT and AWD will only be offered on the top-of-the-line trims. We in India will also get the car with the 1.5-litre petrol engine as well as the 1.5-litre diesel.
The growing demand for SUVs globally has probably prompted Ford to bring the EcoSport to the American market. While we consider it a C-segment SUV, it will, in the US of A, be an alternative to the range of compact hatchbacks that they have on sale and debut in early 2018.

thread.title: Driven To The Spotlight By Trump, Ford May Have To Go The Distance To Perform
thread.title_full: Driven To The Spotlight By Trump, Ford May Have To Go The Distance To Perform

posts.title: Driven To The Spotlight By Trump, Ford May Have To Go The Distance To Perform
posts.text:
Send Message Summary 
Thanks to Trump, Ford may have to play a prominent role in addressing this new, politically-induced business challenge, that is, how to make its foreign investments work. 
Ford could try to sell locally its foreign-produced cars, including those made in Mexico, where the company ought to substantially grow its market share. 
Without having to sell anything back to the U.S. from overseas, Ford and other car makers would have to build up their U.S. manufacturing facilities to meet domestic demand. Ford Motor Company (NYSE: F ), repeatedly a target by then candidate Trump for shipping jobs to Mexico, must now have a contingent plan on how to make its foreign investments work if President Trump resorts to trade barriers to potentially block selling the company's Mexican-made cars back to the U.S. While businesses may find it easier to invest capital wherever profitability may take them, barring unusual governmental restrictions, they can face more fluid trade policies at the will of an administration that may or may not work in their favor at different times. It's been reported that prior to the election, Bill Ford had discussed with Trump the candidate's criticism of the company's plan to invest in Mexico. The discussion was later described as "infuriating and frustrating" by the executive chairman, seemingly suggesting no agreements were reached thus far. A potential solution for Ford may rest on whether the company can manage to shift its focus from trying to prevent rising trade tariffs to considering to sell locally its Mexican-made cars. Meanwhile, to fill any resulting shortfall in supplying the U.S. auto market, Ford would have to increase domestic productions and thus hire U.S. workers, a move that would be both a necessary business move and the right semi-political action. Ford reported 93,000 in wholesale vehicle units in 2015 from Mexico, a market of 1.4 million units of annual sales. It gives the company a market share of 6.7% in the Mexican auto market, less than half of the company's 14.7% market share in the U.S., where Ford sold a total of 2.7 million vehicles in 2015. Ford's U.S. sales alone are larger than the size of the entire Mexican auto market, making it easier for the company to scale up its Mexican productions. Ford could use its current investments in Mexico and potentially more in the future to gain market share there, especially considering its current 6.7% share of the Mexican auto market is a decline from the 8% in 2013. As Ford grows in Mexico by supplying its local productions exclusively to the Mexican market, it wouldn't have to worry about trying to sell some of them back to the U.S. Trump's manufacturing-related trade argument is based on the perceived U.S. companies' unfair practice of moving productions overseas for lower costs and then selling their foreign made products back to the U.S. domestic markets. Foregoing that argument, Ford and other multinational companies could still invest in international markets, but their investments in foreign, low-cost productions should lead to locally made goods being sold locally. Businesses generally like to expand their markets' geographic reach, including internationally, if they believe they could go in to compete and earn a profit. However, the globalization as we know may take on a lesser scale if it becomes common over time that locally produced goods using foreign capital is expected to stay in local markets. Thus, Ford and other domestic car makers would have to start considering to play each market separately using local productions if, for example, they could no longer tie their Mexican auto productions to the U.S. market. Incurring higher labor costs in the U.S. may cut into margins initially, and this can be particularly challenging for Ford whose various profit margins mostly trail those of its peers. While investing overseas and selling foreign-made products back to the U.S. is likely to be restrained under the Trump administration, other direct imports to the U.S. could also be negatively affected if tougher trade deals are to be proposed. For the U.S. auto market, this would potentially mean fewer cars imported from foreign companies such as the all-too-familiar Japanese and European auto makers. One way to still meet the U.S. car sales demand would be for foreign companies to invest more in additional manufacturing facilities in the U.S. This would allow them to produce cars in the U.S. and sell them to the U.S. market. However, as new capacities are being built up, there could be a certain degree of shift in market shares among auto companies. If Ford could ready its existing, unused production facilities more quickly than foreign rivals, it'd be in a better position to gain market share from companies that might have to break ground for new plants. Higher sales volumes would help Ford lower unit production costs and as a result, improve margins. Disclosure: I/we have no positions in any stocks mentioned, and no plans to initiate any positions within the next 72 hours.

thread.title_full: Ford‚Äôs EcoSport Gets Miniscule Motor and a Big Fat Unveiling

posts.author: Matt Posky
posts.title: Ford‚Äôs EcoSport Gets Miniscule Motor and a Big Fat Unveiling
posts.text:
Tweet 
Ford‚Äôs a little late to the subcompact crossover party, so it‚Äôs making a lot of noise to make up for it. The company hosted a highly publicized live Snapchat unveiling for the EcoSport last night, complete with DJ Khaled chanting the vehicle‚Äôs name while gesturing at it and dancing around. 
From a global perspective, it‚Äôs technically not a new car . However, it will be new for North America, and serves to fill an important gap in the company‚Äôs lineup. With subcompact crossover sales increasing 30 percent this year, Ford needed to throw something into this crowded segment. 
Surprisingly, the United States is being offered the turbocharged 1.0-liter EcoBoost three-cylinder, in addition to a 2.0-liter four-pot. Drivers opting for the 2.0-liter get four-wheel drive as standard, and Ford says both engines will come with six-speed automatic transmissions. 
Ford is also bragging about the EcoSport‚Äôs 30 stowage pockets, bins, and hooks. While that may not be incredibly exciting information to a normal person, those are the kind of touches that make a car more livable and get a crossover consumer‚Äôs mouth watering. 
Additional practicalities include a horizontally swinging tailgate, movable floor boards, and fold-away second row seats, allowing drivers to turn the rear space into a flat open expanse for cargo. 
Features will be dependent on trim level and the little crossover gets all of the Ford staples: S, SE, SES and Titanium. The Titanium receives a B&O Play audio system with 10 speakers. Meanwhile, the SES gets copper accents for the interior, sport seats, and a tuned suspension. It seems that all trims offer an eight-inch infotainment unit in the center stack with Sync 3. 
The EcoSport is expected to go on sale in early 2018. 
[Images: Ford Motor Company]

thread.section_title: Ford CEO Fields Looking Forward To ‚ÄòVery Productive‚Äô Discussion With Trump About U.S. Economy ‚Äì CBS Detroit
thread.title: Ford CEO Fields Looking Forward To ‚ÄòVery Productive‚Äô Discussion With Trump About U.S. Economy
thread.title_full: Ford CEO Fields Looking Forward To ‚ÄòVery Productive‚Äô Discussion With Trump About U.S. Economy

posts.author: mfusinski
posts.title: Ford CEO Fields Looking Forward To ‚ÄòVery Productive‚Äô Discussion With Trump About U.S. Economy
posts.text:
DETROIT (WWJ) ‚Äì The president and CEO Ford Motor Co. says he‚Äôs ready and willing to work with President-elect Donald Trump.
Speaking to WWJ‚Äôs Jeff Gilbert from the LA Auto Show, Mark Fields said now that election is over, it‚Äôs time for Trump to focus on policy ‚Äî and he‚Äôs optimistic.
‚ÄúWe believe the right policies are going to be put in place because I think, Jeff, we have, we all have the same common goal which is you know, we want a healthy U.S. economy,‚Äù Fields said. ‚ÄúAnd as we think about some of the policies that may be put in place we‚Äôll engage, I think, in a very productive discussion all with that in mind, of keeping the U.S. economy very healthy.‚Äù
Trump has criticized Ford for importing vehicles from Mexico ‚Äî something that other carmakers also do ‚Äî and has threatened tariffs of 35 percent on those cars. The president-elect has called NAFTA a ‚Äúworst trade deal in history,‚Äù and a ‚Äúdisaster,‚Äù and has said as president he would negotiate for better terms with both Mexico and Canada.
If those countries don‚Äôt agree to his adjustments Trump said that he just may scrap the deal all together.
Without specifically addressing those issues, Fields said he‚Äôs very much looking forward to a conversation with Trump.
‚ÄúWe have a proven track record going all the way back to the administration of Teddy Roosevelt, since when we were first founded, of having good working relationships with policy makers on both sides of the aisle,‚Äù Fields said, adding that he does believe there‚Äôs some common ground.
‚ÄúOf course we agree with the president-elect it‚Äôs about bringing people together and we look forward to working with him and the administration and growing the economy,‚Äù he said.
Meantime, at this week‚Äôs auto show , Fields said he‚Äôs focused on engaging with the public about the future of the auto industry.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really interesting because this is the first show that‚Äôs actually merging traditional auto show day with a connected car expo, so it‚Äôs the industry‚Äôs first integration of both a tech and an auto show,‚Äù Fields said. ‚ÄúSo we‚Äôre making news on both sides as we transform to an auto and a mobility company.‚Äù

thread.title: Meet the Ford EcoSport mini-SUV: Global 'ute comes to U.S. market
thread.title_full: Meet the Ford EcoSport mini-SUV: Global 'ute comes to U.S. market

posts.title: Meet the Ford EcoSport mini-SUV: Global 'ute comes to U.S. market
posts.text:
Pinterest Email In a day long reveal that featured a tiny house, tiny zoo, terrestrial surfing simulators , tiny hors d‚Äôoeuvres, a giant mural of John Ritter , a screen printing stand and DJ Khaled , Ford revealed their smallest crossover, the EcoSport. The EcoSport has been on sale elsewhere in the world since 2003 but this version, built in and imported from India, will be the first one sold in the US. When it goes on sale here in 2018, the EcoSport will be powered by either Ford‚Äôs amazing little 1-liter turbo 3-cylinder in front-wheel-drive spec or a naturally aspirated 2-liter four in all-wheel drive configuration. A six-speed automatic will be the only transmission offered. There will be four trim levels available and ten exterior color choices. 2017 Chevy Trax first drive: Refreshed crossover gets a familiar face 
The Chevy Trax has spent just a few years on sale in the States, but it's been largely unchanged since its global launch in 2013. That, well, changes for 2017: You‚Äôll still ... The interior will feel familiar to you if you‚Äôve spent time in a current generation Focus or Fiesta . In the few moments I spent in the car, it felt comfortable and well designed, and surprisingly spacious with a few minor imperfections. It‚Äôs not a luxury car, there‚Äôs still that familiar oily-looking plastic, but it should suit the prospective buyer very well. It should be noted that the car I sat in was a pre-production model, so we‚Äôll reserve judgement for when we get a look at the production version. The EcoSport will also come with a ‚Äúfloating‚Äù 8-inch touch-screen running SYNC 3, which finally works quickly and intuitively. Below the screen are two quick-charge USB ports to charge phones, but in continuation with a troubling trend now impacting a number of automakers the beloved 3.5mm ‚Äúaux-cord‚Äù input is nowhere to be found. Speccing the Titanium trim package gets you a 10-speaker B&O Play stereo system. Ford made a point to say that the front tweeters and door speakers were actually branded B&O, while others are not. The rear hatch area is most notable for a gate that swings out and to your left when you‚Äôre facing it. The rear seats fold flat, and there‚Äôs moveable floorboard that can be raised and lowered so that items can be stored beneath it. Pricing, fuel economy and specs weren‚Äôt announced--we‚Äôll post them as soon as we have them. 
By Michael Martinez, Automotive News READ THIS NEXT

posts.title: U.S. News Best Cars Announces the 2017 Best Vehicle Brands
posts.text:
U.S. News & World Report
Winners: Honda, Mazda, Ford and Porsche
WASHINGTON , Nov. 15, 2016 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- U.S. News & World Report, the global authority in rankings and consumer advice, today announced winners of the 2017 Best Vehicle Brand awards . The annual awards recognize brands with top-performing vehicles in four major categories: SUVs ‚Äì including Crossovers and Minivans ‚Äì Cars, Trucks and Luxury.
Last year's winning brands continue to dominate in 2017:
Best SUV Brand: Honda
With comfortable interiors and family-friendly features, Honda leads the Best SUV Brand category. Honda's lineup includes the Honda CR-V, Honda HR-V, Honda Odyssey and the redesigned Honda Pilot, all of which rank at or near the top of their classes in Compact SUVs, Subcompact SUVs , Minivans and Midsize SUVs , respectively.
Best Car Brand: Mazda
For the second year, Mazda claims the No. 1 spot. Mazda's lineup of cars, including the Mazda3 and MX-5 Miata, earn positive reviews for well-made interiors and driving dynamics.
Best Truck Brand: Ford
Ford's F-150 line of pickups have fuel-saving engine designs, some of the best payload and tow ratings in the class, easy handling and roomy cabins.
Best Luxury Brand: Porsche
In recent years Porsche has expanded its lineup to include the Panamera, a super-luxury sedan , as well as the Cayenne and Macan SUVs. The models live up to the Porsche's performance-driven heritage while also providing the rich interiors and connectivity features that today's luxury buyers demand.
"Consumers have an overwhelming number of factors to consider when comparing cars," says Jamie Page Deaton , managing editor of U.S. News Best Cars. "The Best Vehicle Brand awards simplify the process by giving people guidance on the top brands in the categories that matter to them."
The Best Vehicle Brands methodology is an objective, analysis-driven assessment of quality across all of a brand's offerings within the four categories (SUVs, Cars, Trucks and Luxury). Brand ratings are based on the U.S. News Best Cars overall scores for each vehicle, which incorporate the consensus opinions of the automotive industry as well as safety and reliability data.
About U.S. News and Best Cars
Best Cars , the automotive channel of U.S. News & World Report, publishes rankings of the majority of new vehicles sold in America. U.S. News annually publishes the Best Cars awards, including Best Vehicle Brands , Best Cars for the Money and Best Cars for Families . Best Cars had over 45 million unique visitors over the past year, with over 65 percent of visitors actively shopping for a car. Close to 80 percent of active shoppers reported that the U.S. News Best Cars site influenced their car purchasing decision.
U.S. News & World Report is a digital news and information company that empowers people to make better, more informed decisions about important issues affecting their lives. Focusing on Education, Health, Personal Finance, Travel, Cars and News & Opinion, USNews.com provides consumer advice, rankings, news and analysis to serve people making complex decisions throughout all stages of life. More than 37 million people visit USNews.com each month for research and guidance. Founded in 1933, U.S. News is headquartered in Washington, D.C.
Logo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20100603/PH13717LOGO

posts.author: RYAN ROBINSON | Staff Writer
posts.title: Ephrata sergeant crashes police SUV into back of occupied vehicle
posts.text:
1 of 2 Courtesy of Ephrata police 
An Ephrata police sergeant crashed this marked 2016 Ford Explorer vehicle into the back of an occupied car at East Main Street and Ridge Avenue in the borough Monday evening. Courtesy of Ephrata police 
An Ephrata police sergeant crashed into the back of this occupied sport utility vehicle at East Main Street and Ridge Avenue in the borough Monday evening. Ephrata sergeant crashes police SUV into back of occupied vehicle ( ‚Ä¶ ) Courtesy of Ephrata police 
An Ephrata police sergeant crashed this marked 2016 Ford Explorer vehicle into the back of an occupied car at East Main Street and Ridge Avenue in the borough Monday evening. Courtesy of Ephrata police 
An Ephrata police sergeant crashed into the back of this occupied sport utility vehicle at East Main Street and Ridge Avenue in the borough Monday evening. 
No one was seriously injured when an Ephrata police sergeant crashed his marked cruiser into the back of a citizen‚Äôs car Monday night, police said. 
Aimee Andrew, 20, of Ephrata, was stopped on East Main Street, waiting for clearance to make a left turn onto Ridge Avenue at 7:15 p.m. when Sergeant Matthew Randolph struck her from behind, Ephrata police Chief Bill Harvey said. 
‚ÄúWe're very grateful that no one was seriously injured, and that everyone was able to walk away,‚Äù he said. 
Andrew was driving a 1999 tan Dodge Durango, and Randolph a 2016 Ford Explorer that is a marked police cruiser. 
Medical personnel examined Andrew and a young child in her sport utility vehicle at the scene and they did not require medical transport, Harvey said. Randolph later drove himself to WellSpan Ephrata Community Hospital, had a painful hand checked out and was released. He was able to return to work his following shift. 
The crash caused extensive damage to the left front of the cruiser, which was only recently added to the department‚Äôs fleet, Harvey said. An estimate of the damage has not yet been determined. Both vehicles were towed, the chief said. 
Ephrata police have not filed any charges in the crash, saying they are still investigating. 
Harvey said since Ephrata police have an accident reconstructionist on staff and the wreck did not include a death or serious injuries, a state police investigation is not required. 
Randolph was on patrol at the time of the crash, Ephrata police Lt. Chris McKim said. He was responding to a call, but it was not an emergency. 
Randolph ‚Äúwas checking dispatch screen for a suspicious activity in progress‚Äù when the wreck occurred, McKim said. The wreck may have been caught by a camera in the cruiser, but it may take some time to retrieve it due to the extensive damage. Tags

thread.title: 2018 Ford EcoSport: Ford enters the subcompact segment
thread.title_full: 2018 Ford EcoSport: Ford enters the subcompact segment

posts.title: 2018 Ford EcoSport: Ford enters the subcompact segment
posts.text:
2018 Ford EcoSport: Ford enters the subcompact segment Photo: Alain Morin Print 
In the last few years, the subcompact SUV category has grown and isn‚Äôt showing signs of slowing down. It notably includes the Nissan JUKE, the Honda HR-V, the Mazda CX-3, the Jeep Renegade and the Subaru Crosstrek. Ford will soon be joining them with its new model, the EcoSport. 
It may be new for us, but not the rest of the world. The EcoSport first appeared in 2003, and a new generation arrived in 2012. The model that just unveiled will hit Canadian dealerships in early 2018, so we can presume it will be a 2018 model. 
EcoSport doesn‚Äôt always mean EcoBoost In the powertrain department, we‚Äôll find the 1.0-litre EcoBoost engine that‚Äôs also offered in the Fiesta, which will be connected to the front wheels only. There will also be a naturally aspirated, 2.0-litre four that will be exclusively matched to an all-wheel drivetrain. In both cases, output hasn‚Äôt been announced, but a six-speed automatic transmission will be standard. Curiously, while simple details such as curb weight, power and cargo space are kept secret, the vehicle‚Äôs chief engineer didn‚Äôt hesitate to talk about towing capacity, set at 1400 lbs. (635 kg) for the 1.0L engine, and 2000 lbs. (907 kg) for the 2.0L mill. Seeing how strained the 1.0L engine felt in the Focus, which is heavier than the Fiesta, we can‚Äôt imagine it being able to pull such a load. But anyway, we‚Äôll see. 
Floating screen and storage space Inside the cockpit, the design is pure Ford, but the central eight-inch touchscreen is now of the ‚Äúfloating‚Äù type like in Mazda and Mercedes-Benz products. That‚Äôs progress, I suppose. SYNC 3, Android Auto and Apple CarPlay will be included. In fact, pretty much every connectivity option we can think of should be available in the 2018 Ford EcoSport, either standard or as an option. During the media presentation before the Los Angeles Auto Show press days, Ford invited DJ Khaled to entertain the crowd, a rapper that was previously unknown to me‚Äîbut well-known judging by the younger people in attendance. If Ford wants to attract a younger clientele, it figured out how to do it.

thread.title_full: Ram Reportedly Working On V8 Pickup Truck To Compete With Ford's Raptor

posts.author: autoevolution (Sebastian Toma)
posts.title: Ram Reportedly Working On V8 Pickup Truck To Compete With Ford's Raptor
posts.text: Ram Reportedly Working On V8 Pickup Truck To Compete With Ford's Raptor 15 Nov 2016, 10:42   Rumors Ram , the American brand focused on pickup trucks and utility vehicles, is reportedly working on a production model that will become the direct competitor of the Ford Raptor. This September, Ram revealed a Hellcat V8 powered pickup truck , which was named Ram Rebel TRX. The vehicle was showcased as a concept, without any mention of a potential production model. However, the American truck maker made the prototype fully functional, and it operated without a hitch. It was claimed that the Rebel TRX could drive at 160 km/h (100 mph) ‚Äúanywhere.‚Äù Evidently, they did not mean it could handle on water, but any crossable terrain that does not have a pronounced slope or any other element that could hinder travel could be driven on at the specified speed. This happened thanks to the heavy-duty suspension that was fitted to the Rebel TRX, along with the detuned Hellcat engine that still provided over 570 HP . The suspension itself has 37 inches of travel, which is 40% more than a standard Ram 1500. If that does not impress you, it had 37-inch tires, and the vehicle seemed to be able to match and beat a Ford Raptor in just about any territory. With over a month and a half since the moment it was first revealed, rumors have emerged that Fiat Chrysler Automobiles has approved the development of a production version of the Rebel TRX Concept. While we do not have anything official on the subject, one could expect FCA to sell a production pickup truck inspired by the Ram Rebel TRX. Even though V8 sourced from the Hellcat twins might not make it to production, it would not surprise us if it did. After all, Ram needs the numbers and bragging rights, while Ford would love a competitor in this segment . May the best souped-up OEM pickup truck win!

thread.title: U.S.-spec 2018 Ford EcoSport Will Be Built in India
thread.title_full: U.S.-spec 2018 Ford EcoSport Will Be Built in India

posts.author: autoevolution (Mircea Panait)
posts.title: U.S.-spec 2018 Ford EcoSport Will Be Built in India
posts.text: U.S.-spec 2018 Ford EcoSport Will Be Built in India 15 Nov 2016, 9:41   Car Profile In early 2018, the Ford Motor Company will start importing the EcoSport into the United States of America from India. Slated to be built at the manufacturer‚Äôs Chennai plant, the EcoSport holds the title of first U.S.-market Ford model to be produced in India. But first, a quick recap about the second-generation EcoSport. Introduced back in January 2012 and based on the Fiesta‚Äôs B2E platform, the EcoSport already went through a couple of minor updates. First and foremost, the EcoSport lost its swing-out door-mounted spare wheel in 2015 . After that, the European-spec EcoSport added a PowerShift transmission for the 1.5 Ti-VCT. Be that as it may, the 2018 Ford EcoSport represents yet another update for the crossover, one that transmutes the EcoSport into a more mature vehicle. Dubbed ‚Äúperfect for the adventures that lie ahead‚Äù and aimed at people who want to ‚Äúlive big,‚Äù the 2018 EcoSport is noticeably more pleasing to the eye compared to the EU-spec 2016 EcoSport. The interior, however, is a significant improvement over the current model, thanks to a redesign of the dash and the addition of a Ford SYNC 3 8-inch infotainment system. Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are on the menu, as is SYNC Connect, the smartphone app that allows owners to lock, unlock, and start the vehicle via their mobile phones. For those who want to go all-out with the options, there‚Äôs an available B&O Play audio system with 10 speakers and 675 watts to play with. Be that as it may, the interior still looks very, very plasticky. In terms of customization, customers have 10 paint choices, 7 ambient lighting options, and 4 trim levels: S, SE, SES, and the top-of-the-range Titanium. To be offered with either the 1.0 EcoBoost turbo-3 or a 2.0-liter 4-cylinder engine, the 2018 EcoSport comes as standard with a six-speed automatic transmission. All-wheel-drive is available only on SES and Titanium models equipped with the 2.0-liter mill. The visual updates performed on the U.S.-spec 2018 Ford EcoSport will trickle down to the European model, which is slated to go into production at Ford‚Äôs plant in Craiova, Romania , in 2017. Editor's note: 2018 Ford EcoSport AWD Ford EcoSport crossover Ford facelift 2016 Los Angeles Auto Show

posts.author: detroitnews.com
posts.title: News@noon: Bolt-ing to victory, sexiest 'Rock' alive
posts.text:
Buyers will be able to customize their Ford EcoSport, choosing from 10 exterior colors, seven ambient lighting options and four trims: S, SE, SES and Titanium. The EcoSport will be at the Los Angeles Auto Show, open to the public November 18-27. (Photo: Ford) 
Today is Tuesday, Nov. 15, 2016, and we're getting a look at what's to come in Detroit in January.
The Los Angeles Auto Show is underway, and compact SUVs are the stars of the show, particularly Ford's imported EcoSport , which is due to arrive in early 2018.
The 2017 Chevrolet Bolt EV took home Motor Trend magazine‚Äôs coveted Car of the Year honors last night. The highly anticipated Bolt, which is due in showrooms by the end of the year, offers an estimated 238 miles of all-electric range with a price tag of less than $30,000, minus a federal income tax rebate.
Motor Trend also named the Mercedes-Benz GLC as its 2017 SUV of the Year, and the 2017 Ford Super Duty as its Truck of the Year.
Here's what else we're covering today:
Cleaves in court 

The preliminary examination for former Michigan State basketball star Mateen Cleaves on rape charges is underway this morning in a Flint courtroom. The rape charges are in connection with an allegation by a 24-year-old Mount Morris woman that the 39-year-old Cleaves sexually assaulted her in a Mundy Township hotel in September 2015 after she rode with him following a charity golf outing.
Pleading guilty 

A 41-year-old Plymouth-Canton Community Schools middle school teacher‚Äôs aide pleaded guilty Monday to remaining criminal charges in connection with allegations she engaged in oral sex with teenage male students, some of whom are believed to be her daughters‚Äô 15-year-old friends. War crimes 

U.S. troops and CIA agents could face investigation and possible charges by the International Criminal Court after its chief prosecutor said in a report that they may have committed war crimes by torturing detainees in Afghanistan. Dancing with Megatron 
Calvin Johnson Jr. tangoed to ‚ÄúSeven Nation Army‚Äù by the Detroit-based band The White Stripes on Monday night.   (Photo: Video capture) 

Former Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson Jr. tangoed his way to the ‚ÄúDancing with the Stars‚Äù finals on the ABC reality television show Monday night. Johnson and professional dancer Lindsay Arnold are among four remaining couples who will compete for the Mirror Ball Trophy in the show‚Äôs finals next week. The three other celebrities left in the the competition include singer Jana Kramer of Rochester Hills, Olympic gymnast Laurie Hernandez and IndyCar driver James Hinchcliffe.
Implications of a Trump presidency 

Among the things that could change under President Donald Trump: automaker regulations (minus those for cars made in Mexico), deportation policy, school lunches (Trump is a fan of fast food), and legal abortions (Roe v. Wade could be in peril, experts say). President Barack Obama is visiting Greece right now , his first international trip since the election. He's making assurances that the U.S. will remain with NATO, even after Trump said during his campaign that the U.S. might pull out of the NATO alliance if other countries don‚Äôt pay more. The protests against Trump continue as thousands of students left high school classrooms in California, Colorado, Maryland, Washington and other states, many declaring concerns over the president-elect‚Äôs comments about minorities and the effect he will have on their communities. Revival in New Center 

Seventeen months after the Fisher and Albert Kahn buildings were sold in a $12.2 million deal, owners of the New Center properties say they plan to invest up to an estimated $100 million to revive the architectural jewels. Sexiest "Rock" alive 
Dwayne ‚ÄúThe Rock‚Äù Johnson was named "Sexiest Man Alive" by People magazine on Nov. 15, 2016.   (Photo: Richard Shotwell / AP) 

Former WWE champ Dwayne ‚ÄúThe Rock‚Äù Johnson can add People‚Äôs ‚ÄúSexiest Man Alive‚Äù title to his list of accomplishments. The wrestler-turned-actor was crowned this year‚Äôs winner Tuesday morning. 
Happy hunting 

Honoring a tradition that reaches back for generations, Michigan hunters will head to the woods today for the opening of deer season. It is a special time of the year for those who love the outdoors and enjoy hunting, a chance to renew acquaintances and bond with friends and family (not to mention the huge economic impact it has on our state). So go out, have fun and be safe . Detroit News at noon is a daily roundup of the most talked-about stories on detroitnews.com . For more anytime, like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter , Instagram (@detroitnews), Snapchat (Search for "Detroitnews") and LinkedIn .

thread.title: Ford CEO: "We are on the cusp of a mobility revolution"
thread.title_full: Ford CEO: "We are on the cusp of a mobility revolution"

posts.author: Charles Fleming
posts.title: Ford CEO: "We are on the cusp of a mobility revolution"
posts.text:
L.A. Auto Show 2016 live updates: Jaguar leaps into the all-electric market with an SUV Nov. 15, 2016, 9:30 a.m. 
The Los Angeles Auto Show opens to the public Friday and ends Nov. 27. Take a look through our coverage from the four days of press previews and keynotes, known as AutoMobility L.A., to see photos and analysis of the latest high-tech offerings. Nov. 15, 2016, 9:30 a.m. Ford CEO: "We are on the cusp of a mobility revolution" Charles Fleming (Myung J. Chun   
Embracing rather than fleeing from a mobility future that will almost certainly not include the automotive industry in its current formulation, Ford CEO Mark Fields told attendees of the just-convened AutoMobility LA car convention that his company is running headlong into an era in which cars are no longer Ford's principal business. 
"We are on the cusp of a mobility revolution," said Fields. "While we will continue to make great vehicles, they are no longer our entire game." 
Speaking to an audience of about 300 industry professionals, wearing a blazer and open-necked dress shirt, Fields lauded the Los Angeles Auto Show executives for rebranding the industry-only portion of their annual event as AutoMobility -- and for stepping toward a future that, so far, no one can quite define. (Myung J. Chun   
"We are attending the first major automotive show in the world that isn't just about cars," Fields said. 
The CEO said the company's future will depend upon cooperation with cities, among other things, to design transportation solutions for metropolitan areas. Characterizing this as "optimizing roads for the number of people on them, not the number of vehicles on them," Fields stressed partnerships such as Ford's with the urban shuttle service Chariot as key to future solutions. 
He also said that his company will have autonomous cars on the road, in partnership with a ride sharing service, by 2021. 
He also announced a partnership between Ford and former New York mayor Michael Bloomberg to work with cities to solve mobility problems. 
Raising the spectre of company founder Henry Ford's successful attempt to liberate working Americans from the personal mobility system known as the horse by introducing an affordable automobile, a century ago, Fields said, "We've spent the last 100 years getting ready for this moment." thread.title: Ford CEO: We are keeping our international plans despite Republican policy proposals
thread.title_full: Ford CEO: We are keeping our international plans despite Republican policy proposals

posts.title: Ford CEO: We are keeping our international plans despite Republican policy proposals
posts.text:
Adam Jeffery | CNBC Mark Fields, CEO of Ford Motor Co. 
Ford will not change its plans to fit with what President-elect Donald Trump has said about instating tariffs and bringing manufacturing back to the United States, CEO Mark Fields said on Tuesday. 
"We all share the same objective: we want a strong, vibrant U.S. economy," Fields told CNBC's " Fast Money Halftime Report ." 
The CEO said that the company will continue to produce some of its trucks in Mexico despite Trump's threats to impose tariffs on all vehicles built in Mexico for sale in the United States. Tariffs will impact the entire auto sector and economy, a risk the Republican administration would not want to take, Fields said. 
Fields said that there will be no change to the number of jobs Ford creates within the U.S. with the new plans the company is implementing to utilize its "global manufacturing footprint." 
Ford reported a decline in October's U.S. sales of 11.7 percent earlier this month, lower than analysts' predictions of 10.9 percent.

thread.title: Ford in ‚Äòconstant communication‚Äô with Trump team
thread.title_full: Ford in ‚Äòconstant communication‚Äô with Trump team

posts.author: detroitnews.com
posts.title: Ford in ‚Äòconstant communication‚Äô with Trump team
posts.text:
Buy Photo Caption: Ford CEO Mark Fields on Tuesday, Nov. 15, delivers the morning keynote address at the Los Angeles Auto Show‚Äôs Automobility LA conference. (Photo: Michael Wayland / The Detroit News) Buy Photo
Los Angeles ‚Äî Ford Motor Co. has been in ‚Äúconstant communication‚Äù with Donald Trump‚Äôs transition team since the election, with CEO Mark Fields sending a congratulatory letter to the president-elect.
Fields declined to comment if Trump, who targeted Ford throughout his campaign for investing in Mexico, responded to the letter.
‚ÄúWe have had conversations with the transition team,‚Äù he said Tuesday after a speech at the Los Angeles Auto Show‚Äôs Mobility LA conference. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve sent a congratulatory letter to the president-elect and we look forward to working with the new administration and the entire newly-elected Congress.‚Äù
Ford, including Fields, went on the defensive several times during the presidential election, attempting to defend the automaker‚Äôs Mexico investment and to correct statements Trump made about the automaker shuttering plants domestically to move production south of the border.
Trump repeatedly used as campaign talking points the announcements by Ford it would invest billions in Mexico and move production of the Ford Focus and C-MAX from its Michigan Assembly Plant in Wayne to Mexico.
Fields on Tuesday said the company has no changes to its plans, citing, as he has in the past, that Ford will add ‚Äútwo very exciting products that will be coming into the Michigan Assembly plant.‚Äù Those products, as reported by The Detroit News and other media outlets, are the Ford Ranger pickup and Ford Bronco SUV.
Trump has indicated he would end the trade pact with Canada and Mexico and slap a 10 percent to 35 percent tariff on vehicles and parts made in Mexico that are imported into the U.S. He also has threatened tariffs of up to 45 percent exported from China to the U.S.
Fields on Tuesday said a tariff such as that on Mexico ‚Äúcould have a huge impact on the U.S. economy.‚Äù He said he continues to ‚Äúbe convinced that the right policies will prevail, because I think we all share the same objective, which is a healthy and vibrant U.S. economy.‚Äù
Carmakers have banked on using low-cost Mexican labor for small-car production, which has lower profit margins. Automakers, including the Detroit Three, have announced more than $24 billion in Mexican investments since 2010, according to the Center for Automotive Research.

posts.title: Next-gen Ford Expedition spy photos reveal more details
posts.text:
Next-gen Ford Expedition spy photos reveal more details November 15, 2016 @ 12:15 pm Comments 
Have an opinion about this story? Click here to submit a Letter to the Editor , and we may publish it in print. 
The next generation of Ford‚Äôs Expedition SUV is expected to be offered in two wheelbases, based on new spy photographs of the vehicle undergoing testing on public roads around Ford Motor Co.‚Äôs product development campus in Dearborn, Mich. Photo credit: JIM DUNNE 
The next Expedition is scheduled to debut in 2017, possibly as a 2018 model. 
And two different sized grilles indicate a variety of engines will be offered. Photo credit: JIM DUNNE 
The engine lineup for the Expedition will likely mimic the F-150 pickup: a base 3.5-liter, 2.7-liter twin turbo V-6 and a high output twin turbo 3.5-liter V-6. A 5.0-liter V-8 or a 3.0-liter V-6 diesel, the same motor used in Land Rover SUVs, is also expected to be available. 
Transmission choices are likely to be six-speed automatic standard with 10-speed automatic optional. Photo credit: JIM DUNNE 
Styling of the vehicles in the photos shows shorter rear doors cut directly into the rear wheel wells, a more rounded roof and a smaller rear window, says Jim Dunne, the spy photographer who captured the images. The side mirrors also appear new. 
One of the engineering vehicles also has a rear muffler with twin exhausts, a first for Expedition. You can reach Richard Truett at Tags:

thread.title: Ford CEO Mark Fields: We're on the "Cusp of a Mobility Revolution"
thread.title_full: Ford CEO Mark Fields: We're on the "Cusp of a Mobility Revolution"

posts.author: Nick Lucchesi
posts.title: Ford CEO Mark Fields: We're on the "Cusp of a Mobility Revolution"
posts.text:
Ford CEO Mark Fields: We're on the "Cusp of a Mobility Revolution" "We're attending the first major auto show in the world that's not about cars." Cars November 15, 2016 
F ord CEO Mark Fields offered his vision for the future of the car company Tuesday, which involves transportation services ‚Äî ride-sharing, autonomous technology, and even bicycles ‚Äî that he hopes expands the automaker‚Äôs revenue greatly in the coming years while presumably offering everybody more ways to get around their city. 
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre attending the first major auto show in the world that‚Äôs not about cars,‚Äù Fields said, before adding that ‚Äúwe really are on the cusp of the mobility revolution.‚Äù 
Standing in front of a projection of the 2017 Ford GT super car, Fields said cars ‚Äúare still very, very important,‚Äù but continued to acknowledge the company‚Äôs forays into other methods of transportation. ‚ÄúWhile we continue to make great vehicles they are no longer our entire game., he said. (On Monday, Ford debuted the EcoSport, its compact SUV for millennials ). 
‚ÄúWhile we focus on making the car of tomorrow, we also focus on the city of tomorrow,‚Äù Fields told the assembled auto industry players and media during a Tuesday morning keynote at the Los Angeles Auto Show‚Äôs tech-focused media days, branded as Automobility LA. Ford sees all modes of transportation services as its future, even bicycle sharing programs. 
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of talk these days about artificial intelligence and at Ford our intelligence isn‚Äôt artificial, it‚Äôs human,‚Äù Fields said, attempting to calm any fears of creeping automation in factories . ‚ÄúWhat would a city look like if more people were using shared services instead of personally owned vehicles?‚Äù 
Fields said the addition of transportation services could double current revenue from global car sales. He announced on Tuesday that Ford would partner with the Compact of Mayors , a group of city leaders headed by former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg. 
‚ÄúWe have created Ford‚Äôs City Solutions team,‚Äù Fields said. The partnership is in the works in San Francisco, and other cities will follow soon. 
One part of Ford‚Äôs transporation solution is the San Francisco start-up Chariot , now part of the Ford mobility team. The app-based crowd-sourced shuttle service specializes in the ‚Äúfirst mile, last mile‚Äù needs of commuters. It‚Äôs expanded to Austin, Texas and will be in more cities soon. 
‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see substantial revenue opportunities to providing mobility solutions to millions commuters,‚Äù Fields said, noting that there is a ‚Äúgrowing work force in several cities globally, many of whom do not own vehicles today or do business with Ford.‚Äù 
Fields‚Äô keynote opened the first full day of Automobility LA before the actual LA Auto Show kicks off on Friday. There‚Äôs an increased focus on battery-powered cars, autonomy, 3D printing, and big data during the run-up to the auto show, which has traditionally ranked behind bigger shows in past decades. But LA‚Äôs influence on the design industry and the number of design studios here has raised the show‚Äôs stature. 
In August, Fields said that Ford will be ‚Äú mass-producing vehicles with full autonomy within five years,‚Äù specifically with an eye on ride-sharing services. Photos via Getty Images / Bryan Thomas
